Actions.Name: Bite

Traits.Content: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
Traits.Name: Keen Hearing and Smell

Actions.Content: Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.
Actions.Name: Bite

Traits.Content: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
Traits.Name: Spider Climb

Traits.Content: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.
Traits.Name: Web Sense

Traits.Content: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
Traits.Name: Web Walker

Actions.Content: The gibbering mouther makes one bite attack and, if it can, uses its Blinding Spittle.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (5d6) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is killed by this damage, it is absorbed into the mouther.
Actions.Name: Bites

Actions.Content: The mouther spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact. Each creature within 5 feet of the flash must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mouther's next turn.
Actions.Name: Blinding Spittle (Recharge 5-6)

Traits.Content: The ground in a 10-foot radius around the mouther is doughlike difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.
Traits.Name: Aberrant Ground

Traits.Content: The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.
Traits.Name: Gibbering

Actions.Content: The girallon makes five attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Bite

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit. reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) slashing damage.
Actions.Name: Claw

Traits.Content: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 152
Traits.Name: Source

Traits.Content: As a bonus action, the girallon can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.
Traits.Name: Aggressive

Actions.Content: The githyanki makes two silver greatsword attacks.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage. This is a magic weapon attack. On a critical hit against a target in an astral body (as with the astral projection spell), the githyanki can cut the silvery cord that tethers the target to its material body, instead of dealing damage.
Actions.Name: Silver Greatsword

Traits.Content:
The githyanki's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: 
At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible)
3/day each: jump, misty step, nondetection (self only), tongues
1/day each: plane shift, telekinesis
Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)

Actions.Content: The githyanki makes two greatsword attacks.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.
Actions.Name: Greatsword

Traits.Content:
The githyanki's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: 
At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible)
3/day each: jump, misty step, nondetection (self only)
Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)

Actions.Content: The githzerai makes two unarmed strikes.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) psychic damage. This is a magic weapon attack.
Actions.Name: Unarmed Strike

Traits.Content:
The githzerai's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: 
At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible)
3/day each: feather fall, jump, see invisibility, shield
Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)

Traits.Content: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.
Traits.Name: Psychic Defense

Actions.Content: The githzerai makes two unarmed strikes.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) psychic damage. This is a magic weapon attack.

Traits.Content:
The githzerai's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: 
At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible)
3/day each: feather fall, jump, see invisibility, shield
Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)

Traits.Content: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.
Traits.Name: Psychic Defense

Actions.Content: The glabrezu makes four attacks: two with its pincers and two with its fists. Alternatively, it makes two attacks with its pincers and casts one spell.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). The glabrezu has two pincers, each of which can grapple only one target.
Actions.Name: Pincer

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.
Actions.Name: Fist

Actions.Content:
The demon chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning.
A glabrezu has a 30 percent chance of summoning 1d3 vrocks, 1d2 hezrous, or one glabrezu.
A summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.
Actions.Name: Variant: Summon Demon (1/Day)

Traits.Content:
The glabrezu's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). The glabrezu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: 
At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic
1/day each: confusion, fly, power word stun
Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting

Traits.Content: The glabrezu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Traits.Name: Magic Resistance

Actions.Content: The gladiator makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Actions.Name: Spear

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
Actions.Name: Shield Bash

Reactions.Content: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
Reactions.Name: Parry

Traits.Content: The gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
Traits.Name: Brave

Traits.Content: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).
Traits.Name: Brute

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Bite

Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Actions.Name: Spear

Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Longbow

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Shortsword

Actions.Content: Until the end of the turn, the gnoll's speed increases by 60 feet and it doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.
Actions.Name: Sudden Rush

Traits.Content: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

Actions.Content: The gnoll makes two melee attacks with its spear or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

Actions.Name: Bite

Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Actions.Name: Spear

Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage, and the target’s speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.
Actions.Name: Longbow

Traits.Content: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.
Traits.Name: Rampage

Actions.Content: The gnoll makes two attacks, either with its glaive or its longbow, and uses its Incite Rampage if it can.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Bite

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Longbow

Actions.Content: One creature the gnoll can see within 30 feet of it can use its reaction to make a melee attack if it can hear the gnoll and has the Rampage trait.

Traits.Content: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

Actions.Content: The witherling makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its club, or two with its club.

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Bite

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) bludgeoning damage.

Reactions.Content: In response to a gnoll being reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of the witherling, the witherling makes a melee attack.

Traits.Content: When the witherling reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

Traits.Content: If the goat moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
Traits.Name: Charge

Traits.Content: The goat has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.
Traits.Name: Sure-Footed

Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Traits.Content: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.
Traits.Name: Nimble Escape

Actions.Content: The goblin makes two attacks with its scimitar. The second attack has disadvantage.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Javelin

Reactions.Content: When a creature the goblin can see targets it with an attack, the goblin chooses another goblin within 5 feet of it. The two goblins swap places, and the chosen goblin becomes the target instead.

Traits.Content: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Bite

Actions.Content:
The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.
Fire Breath. The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Weakening Breath. The dragon exhales gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Actions.Name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)

Traits.Content: The dragon can breathe air and water.
Traits.Name: Amphibious

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Gore

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.
Actions.Name: Hooves

Actions.Content: The gorgon exhales petrifying gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
Actions.Name: Petrifying Breath (Recharge 5-6)

Traits.Content: If the gorgon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the gorgon can make one attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.
Traits.Name: Trampling Charge

Actions.Content: The goristro makes three attacks: two with its fists and one with its hoof.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.
Actions.Name: Fist

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
Actions.Name: Hoof

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 45 (7d10 + 7) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Gore

Traits.Content: If the goristro moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 38 (7d10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away and knocked prone.
Traits.Name: Charge

Traits.Content: The goristro can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.
Traits.Name: Labyrinthine Recall

Traits.Content: The goristro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Traits.Name: Magic Resistance

Traits.Content: The goristro deals double damage to objects and structures.

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.
Actions.Name: Pseudopod

Traits.Content: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
Traits.Name: Amorphous

Traits.Content:
Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage.
The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.
Traits.Name: Corrode Metal

Traits.Content: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.
Traits.Name: False Appearance

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.
Actions.Name: Pseudopod

Actions.Content: The ooze targets one creature that it can sense within 60 feet of it. The target must make a DC 10 Intelligence saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Actions.Name: Psychic Crush (Recharge 5-6)

Traits.Content: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
Traits.Name: Amorphous

Traits.Content:
Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage.
The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.
Traits.Name: Corrode Metal

Traits.Content: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.
Traits.Name: False Appearance

Actions.Content: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or greatsword.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.
Actions.Name: Claws (Slaad Form Only)

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.
Actions.Name: Greatsword

Traits.Content: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
Traits.Name: Shapechanger

Traits.Content:
The slaad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The slaad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: 
At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, invisibility (self only), mage hand, major image
2/day each: fear, fly, fireball, tongues
1/day: plane shift (self only)
Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting

Traits.Content: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects
Traits.Name: Magic Resistance

Traits.Content: The slaad's weapon attacks are magical.
Traits.Name: Magic Weapons

Traits.Content: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.
Traits.Name: Regeneration

Traits.Content:
Implanted in the slaad's brain is a magic control gem. The slaad must obey whoever possesses the gem and is immune to being charmed while so controlled.
Certain spells can be used to acquire the gem. If the slaad fails its saving throw against imprisonment, the spell can transfer the gem to the spellcaster's open hand, instead of imprisoning the slaad. A wish spell, if cast in the slaad's presence, can be worded to acquire the gem.
A greater restoration spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.
Someone who is proficient in Wisdom (Medicine) can remove the gem from an incapacitated slaad. Each try requires 1 minute of uninterrupted work and a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Medicine) check. Each failed attempt deals 22 (4d10) psychic damage to the slaad.
Traits.Name: Variant: Control Gem

Actions.Content: Graz'zt attacks twice with the Wave of Sorrow.

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target, Hit; 20 (4d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) acid damage.

Actions.Content: Graz'zt magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

LegendaryActions.Content: Graz'zt can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creautre's turn. Graz'zt regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.
Graz'zt attacks once with the Wave of Sorrow.
LegendaryActions.Name: Attack

LegendaryActions.Content: One creature charmed by Graz'zt that Graz'zt can see must use its reaction to move up to its speed as Graz'zt directs.

Traits.Content: Graz'zt can use his action to polymorph into a form that resembles a Medium humanoid, or back into his true form. Aside from his size, his statistics are the same in each form, Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

Traits.Content:
Graz'zt's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 23). Graz'zt can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

3/day each: counterspell, darkness, dominate person, sanctuary, telekinesis, teleport

Traits.Content: If Graz'zt fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Actions.Content:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.
Actions.Name: Illusory Appearance

Actions.Content: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.
Actions.Name: Invisible Passage

Traits.Content: The hag can breathe air and water.
Traits.Name: Amphibious

Traits.Content:
The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: 
At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery
Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting

Traits.Content: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.
Traits.Name: Mimicry

Traits.Content:
When hags must work together, they form covens, in spite of their selfish natures. A coven is made up of hags of any type, all of whom are equals within the group. However, each of the hags continues to desire more personal power.
A coven consists of three hags so that any arguments between two hags can be settled by the third. If more than three hags ever come together, as might happen if two covens come into conflict, the result is usually chaos.
Traits.Name: Hag Coven

Traits.Content:
While all three members of a hag coven are within 30 feet of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves: 
• 1st level (4 slots): identify, ray of sickness
• 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, locate object
• 3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, counterspell, lightning bolt
• 4th level (3 slots): phantasmal killer, polymorph
• 5th level (2 slots): contact other plane, scrying
• 6th level (1 slot): eye bite
For casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12+the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4+the hag's Intelligence modifier.
Traits.Name: Shared Spellcasting (Coven Only)

Traits.Content:
A hag coven can craft a magic item called a hag eye, which is made from a real eye coated in varnish and often fitted to a pendant or other wearable item. The hag eye is usually entrusted to a minion for safekeeping and transport. A hag in the coven can take an action to see what the hag eye sees if the hag eye is on the same plane of existence. A hag eye has AC 10, 1 hit point, and darkvision with a radius of 60 feet. If it is destroyed, each coven member takes 3d10 psychic damage and is blinded for 24 hours.
A hag coven can have only one hag eye at a time, and creating a new one requires all three members of the coven to perform a ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour, and the hags can't perform it while blinded. During the ritual, if the hags take any action other than performing the ritual, they must start over.
Traits.Name: Hag Eye (Coven Only)

The poisoned target is paralyzed, and it can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
The target is also grappled (escape DC 15). If the target is Medium or smaller, it is also restrained until this grapple ends. While grappling the target, the grell has advantage on attack rolls against it and can 't use this attack against other targets. When the grell moves, any Medium or smaller target it is grappling moves with it.

Traits.Content: The grung can breathe air and water.
Traits.Name: Amphibious

Traits.Content: Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung’s skin must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Traits.Name: Poisonous Skin

Traits.Content: The grung's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.
Traits.Name: Standing Leap

Traits.Content:
Grung poison loses its potency 1 minute after being removed from a grung. A similar breakdown occurs if the grung dies.
	A creature poisoned by a grung can suffer an additional effect that varies depending on the grung’s skin color. This effect lasts until the creature is no longer poisoned by the grung.
	 
Green. The poisoned creature can’t move except to climb or make standing jumps. If the creature is flying, it can’t take any actions or reactions unless it lands.
	 
Blue. The poisoned creature must shout loudly or otherwise make a loud noise at the start and end of its turn.
	 
Purple. The poisoned creature feels a desperate need to soak itself in liquid or mud. It can’t take actions or move except to do so or to reach a body of liquid or mud.
Traits.Name: Variant: Grung Poison

Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 it, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage.

The harpy sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 ft. of the harpy that can hear the song must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the song ends. The harpy must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the harpy is incapacitated.
     While charmed by the harpy, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 ft. away from the harpy, the must move on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
     A target that successfully saves is immune to this harpy's song for the next 24 hours.
Actions.Name: Luring Song

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.
Actions.Name: Talons

The demon chooses what to summon and attempts a magical summoning.

A summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

The grapple ends early if the giant stands up.

Traits.Content: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a damaging spell attack if that target is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin and that ally isn’t incapacitated.

The hobgoblin is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:
	 
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, fire bolt, ray of frost, shocking grasp
	
1st level (4 slots): fog cloud, magic missile, thunderwave
	 
2nd level (3 slots): gust of wind, Melf’s acid arrow, scorching ray
	
3rd level (3 slots): fireball, fly, lightning bolt
	 
4th level (1 slot): ice storm
Traits.Name: Spellcasting

Traits.Content:

Cantrips (at will): minor illusion, prestidigitation, true strike
	 
1st level (3 slots): charm person, disguise self, expeditious retreat, silent image

This effect ends if the hobgoblin is incapacitated.

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead poisoned for 5 (1d10) minutes and unconscious while poisoned in this way.

If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or lose 10 (3d6) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an infernal wound. Each time the devil hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 10 (3d6). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

Traits.Content: As a bonus action, the initiate gains advantage on the next ranged attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10+4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target
Actions.Name: Claw

Traits.Content: The crab can breathe air and water.
Traits.Name: Amphibious

Traits.Content: While the crab remains motionless with it's eyestalks and pincers tucked close to it's body, it resembles a natural formation or a pile of detritus. A creature within 30 feet of it can discren its true nature with a successful DC 15 intelligence (Nature) check.
Traits.Name: Shell Camouflage

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

Traits.Content: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.
Traits.Name: Blood Frenzy

Traits.Content: The shark can breathe only underwater.

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.
Actions.Name: Unarmed Strike

Reactions.Content: When the hurricane is hit by a ranged weapon attack, it reduces the damage from the attack by 1d10 + 9. If the damage is reduced to 0, the hurricane can catch the missile if it is small enough to hold in one hand and the hurricane has at least one hand free.
Reactions.Name: Deflect Missiles

Traits.Content:
The hurricane is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells: 
• Cantrips (at will): blade ward, gust, light, prestidigitation
• 1st level (4 slots): feather fall, jump, thunderwave
• 2nd level (2 slots): gust of wind
Traits.Name: Spellcasting

Traits.Content: While the hurricane is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

Traits.Content: While the hurricane is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its walking speed increases by 15 feet (included in its speed).
Traits.Name: Unarmored Movement

Actions.Content: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Bite

Traits.Content: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.
Traits.Name: Hold Breath

Traits.Content:
The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.
At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.
Traits.Name: Multiple Heads

Traits.Content: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.
Traits.Name: Reactive Heads

Traits.Content: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.
Traits.Name: Wakeful

Actions.Content: Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.
Actions.Name: Bite

Traits.Content: The hyena has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hyena's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
Traits.Name: Pack Tactics

Actions.Content: The devil makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claws, and one with its tail.
Actions.Name: Multiattack

Actions.Name: Bite

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.
Actions.Name: Claws

Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.
Actions.Name: Tail

Actions.Content:
The devil magically forms an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 60 feet of it. The wall is 1 foot thick and up to 30 feet long and 10 feet high, or it's a hemispherical dome up to 20 feet in diameter.
When the wall appears, each creature in its space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on, unless the creature is incapacitated. The creature then makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the devil is incapacitated or dies. The wall can be damaged and breached; each 10-foot section has AC 5, 30 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to acid, cold, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. If a section is destroyed, it leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. Whenever a creature finishes moving through the frigid air on a turn, willingly or otherwise, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The frigid air dissipates when the rest of the wall vanishes.
Actions.Name: Wall of Ice

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

When the wall appears, each creature in its space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on, unless the creature is incapacitated. The creature then makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the devil is incapacitated or dies. The wall can be damaged and breached; each 10-foot section has AC 5, 30 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to acid, cold, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. If a section is destroyed, it leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. Whenever a creature finishes moving through the frigid air on a turn, willingly or otherwise, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The frigid air dissipates when the rest of the wall vanishes.

Traits.Content: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Actions.Name: Claws

Actions.Content: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of cold air. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5 (2d4) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Actions.Content: The mephit has a 25 percent chance of summoning 1d4 mephits of its kind. A summoned mephit appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other mephits. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

Traits.Content: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary shard of ice.

Traits.Content: The mephit can innately cast fog cloud, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

Traits.Content: The toad can breathe air or water.

Traits.Content: The toad's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.
